name: Bacon Apples
author: Tracey4840
summary: I cooked apples that I stuffed with brown sugar and cinnamon over a campfire as a dessert for my family when we went camping. In the morning we had bacon with our breakfasts and the kids marinated the bacon in the leftover apples! The bacon was good but we ate the apples after and they where surprisingly good!
ingredients: 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon, or more to taste
directions: Build a campfire and allow the fire to burn until it has accumulated a bed of coals
Rake the coals into a flat bed on one side of the fire
Place apples in a loaf pan
Combine brown sugar and cinnamon in a bowl; spoon into each apple
Place the loaf pan into the campfire or on the grill; cook for about 3 minutes
Carefully remove the pan from the fire and sprinkle bacon over apples
Place in the fire or on the grill for about 5 minutes more
